name: Adobo
instructions: Combine chicken, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns in a pot.
Marinate for 30 minutes.
Bring to a boil, then simmer for 30-40 minutes.
Add sugar and stir.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Sinigang na Baboy
instructions: Boil pork ribs in water until tender.
Add onions and tomatoes, simmer for 10 minutes.
Add radish and eggplant, cook until vegetables are tender.
Add sinigang mix and kangkong.
Simmer for 2 minutes and serve hot.

name: Pancit Canton
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion in a pan.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Add shrimp and cook until pink.
Add carrots and cabbage, stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth and soy sauce, bring to a boil.
Add noodles and cook until liquid is absorbed.
Serve hot.

name: Kare-Kare
ingredients: 1 bundle string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
instructions: Boil oxtail until tender.
Sauté garlic and onion, add annatto seeds for color.
Add boiled oxtail and peanut butter, mix well.
Add ground rice to thicken sauce.
Add vegetables and cook until tender.
Serve with bagoong (shrimp paste).

name: Leche Flan
instructions: Caramelize sugar in a llanera (mold).
Mix egg yolks, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla.
Pour mixture into the mold over caramel.
Steam for 30-40 minutes.
Cool, then invert onto a plate to serve.

name: Laing
instructions: Sauté garlic, onion, and pork until browned.
Add shrimp paste and mix.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a boil.
Add taro leaves and simmer until tender.
Add coconut cream and chilies, cook until thick.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Bicol Express
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion, add pork and cook until browned.
Add shrimp paste and mix.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer until pork is tender.
Add chilies and coconut cream, cook until thick.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Chicken Inasal
ingredients: 1 kg chicken, cut into serving pieces
instructions: Mix vinegar, calamansi juice, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, lemongrass, salt, and pepper.
Marinate chicken for at least 1 hour.
Grill chicken over hot coals, basting with marinade.
Serve with rice and dipping sauce.

name: Paksiw na Bangus
instructions: Arrange bangus, eggplant, garlic, onion, and ginger in a pot.
Add vinegar, water, salt, peppercorns, and chili.
Bring to a boil, then simmer until fish is cooked.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Menudo
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion, add pork and cook until browned.
Add liver and cook for 2 minutes.
Add tomato sauce and soy sauce, simmer for 10 minutes.
Add potatoes, carrots, and peas, cook until tender.
Add bell pepper, simmer for 2 minutes.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Pinakbet
instructions: Sauté garlic, onion, and pork until browned.
Add shrimp paste and tomato, cook for 2 minutes.
Add vegetables and stir-fry.
Add a little water, cover and simmer until vegetables are tender.
Serve hot.

name: Pochero
instructions: Boil beef shank until tender.
Sauté garlic and onion, add chorizo and cook.
Add tomato sauce and beef, simmer for 10 minutes.
Add potatoes, carrots, and bananas, cook until tender.
Add cabbage and pechay, simmer for 2 minutes.
Serve hot.

name: Tortang Talong
instructions: Grill eggplants until skin is charred, peel skin.
Flatten eggplants with a fork.
Sauté garlic, onion, and pork if using.
Beat eggs, season with salt and pepper.
Dip eggplants in egg mixture, fry until golden.
Serve hot with rice.

name: Arroz Caldo
ingredients: Calamansi and fried garlic for garnish
instructions: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Add rice and fish sauce, stir.
Pour in chicken broth, simmer until rice is soft.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with calamansi and fried garlic.

name: Lumpiang Shanghai
instructions: Mix pork, carrot, onion, garlic, egg, soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
Wrap mixture in lumpia wrappers.
Fry until golden brown.
Serve with sweet chili sauce.

name: Ginataang Bilo-Bilo
instructions: Boil tapioca pearls until translucent.
In a pot, combine coconut milk, sweet potato, and bananas.
Add glutinous rice balls and jackfruit.
Simmer until everything is cooked.
Add coconut cream and sugar, cook until thick.
Serve warm.

name: Bulalo
ingredients: 1 kg beef shank with bone marrow
instructions: Boil beef shank in water until tender.
Add onion, garlic, and corn, simmer for 20 minutes.
Add cabbage and pechay, cook for 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot.

name: Dinuguan
instructions: Sauté garlic and onion, add pork and cook until browned.
Add vinegar and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add pork blood and water, stir continuously.
Add chilies, season with salt and pepper.
Simmer until thick.
Serve hot with puto.

name: Halo-Halo
instructions: Layer sweetened beans, nata de coco, jackfruit, and banana in a tall glass.
Add shaved ice on top.
Pour evaporated milk over ice.
Top with leche flan and ube ice cream.
Serve immediately.

name: Puto
instructions: Mix rice flour, sugar, and baking powder.
Add coconut milk and water, mix until smooth.
Pour into molds, top with cheese.
Steam for 20 minutes.
Serve warm.
